I would recommend "Man on Fire" for its intense drama and compelling performances by Rachel Ticotin and Marc Anthony.

On the other hand, if you are looking for a classic romance novel, then I would highly recommend "Pride and Prejudice." This timeless novel features all of the elements that make a classic romance novel so captivating: witty banter between the main characters, steamy bedroom scenes, dramatic love triangles, and even a few unexpected plot twists.

In conclusion, whether you are looking for an intense drama thriller to keep you on the edge of your seat, or you are looking for a timeless classic romance novel to transport you to another world of passion and intrigue, then I would highly recommend "Man on Fire" as an intense drama thriller to keep you on the edge of your seat, and "Pride and Prejudice" as a timeless classic romance novel to transport you to another world of passion and intrigue.

Based on your preferences and the information provided, here are some potential recommendations:
1. Chain Reaction (1996)): A film about how the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic is affecting small businesses and what they are doing to stay open and safe. Talking with business owners from the small town of Camden, Maine, we get information about the challenges that they have navigated past and how they have adapted to running businesses in a pandemic.
2. Super (2010)): A film about Ryan, a young man who has defied social convention and become an ambassador for the sport of competitive beard growing. Through good times and bad, he has pushed on to become the two time world beard champion. He shares this inspirational story with us and guides us through his world in a 6 minute narrative doc. He considers what his world has become due to his beard and contemplates the thought of a world without.
Both movies share similarities in themes such as social norms, self-discovery, and personal growth. They also both have an inspiring story at the heart of it, which can be very moving and uplifting for audiences.
